recipe_name: Poached sole with cherry tomatoes and tarragon butter
author: James Tanner
method: Place the stock, tomatoes, wine and butter into a small, deep frying pan and bring to the boil. Add the sole fillet, reduce the heat and simmer gently for 3-4 minutes, or until cooked through. Stir in the tarragon and set aside to keep warm. Drizzle the asparagus with olive oil. Heat a griddle pan and griddle the asparagus until chargrilled on all sides. To serve, place the griddled asparagus onto a serving plate, top with the sole and pour over the poaching liquid. Garnish with rocket.
ingredients: 200ml/7fl oz hot vegetable stock,  100g/3Â½oz cherry tomatoes, halved,  splash white wine,  30g/1oz butter,  1 sole fillet,  small handful fresh tarragon, chopped,  4-5 asparagus spears,  olive oil, for drizzling,  handful rocket, to serve
